explanation: The buggy program attempts to compute a sum based on the indices of the non-zero elements in the list `a`. The maximum index `i` should only range from 0 to the length of `a` (not exceeding its length), which can be less than 63 depending on the input. I corrected the loop to iterate over `range(len(a))` instead of `range(63)`, thus preventing an IndexError when accessing `a[i]` for indices that do not exist.
